title: Curecanti National Recreation Area: Elk Creek
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping     Camping     Elk Creek                Elk Creek Campground              Elk Creek Campground is located 16 miles west of Gunnison on U.S. Highway 50 on the shore of Blue Mesa Reservoir. All types of camping from tents to large RVs can be accommodated at Elk Creek, but note that there are very few sites with trees. This is the only campground with electricity (Loop D only) at Curecanti. Reservations are strongly recommended for Loop D in the summer months. First-come first-served sites are usually available, but may be hard to find on summer holiday weekends.    Open: All year   Sites: 160    Accessible Sites: yes    Water:  yes, mid-May to mid-September    Flush Toilets:  yes, mid-May to mid-September     Vault Toilets:  yes    Electric Hookups:  yes, Loop D only    Dump Station:  yes    Showers:  yes, mid-May to mid-September   Tables & Fire Grates:  yes    Visitor Center:  yes    Ranger Programs:  yes    Marina:  yes, mid-May to early September   Restaurant:  yes, mid-May to early September    Boat Ramp:  yes    Fish Cleaning Station:  yes    Elevation:  7540 feet            Reservation Information Reservations can be made for Loops A and D only. Reservations must be made at least 3 days in advance. All sites in Loops A and D have a maximum 14 consecutive day stay in a 30 day period.
